review_discussion.author: CohenCyril
review_discussion.comment:
> Specially when does on use `matrix` or `mx`

There are actually very few (10) theorems, one notation and zero definition (except for `matrix` itself which is only used with the notation `'M_(_, _)`) with `matrix` as a substring, 
- `matrixP`, `row_matrixP`, `matrix_sum_delta`, `card_matrix`,`matrix_eq0`, `matrix0Pn`, `matrix_nonzero1`, `matrix_modl`, `matrix_modr` and `gal_matrix`
- and `\matrix_...`.

I believe we could rename all the lemmas to use `mx` instead of `matrix`.
